Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Chris G
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel! even though they were undergoing renovations during our stay, You wouldn't have known it. Very quite and peaceful. Free Breakfast was unbelieveable. different things everyday but we had omelets, ham, waffles, fresh fruit, fresh juices, 4 different kinds of coffee, Very happy with our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Branson for business travel”
Reviews.Author: KJDbiz1
Reviews.Content: I own a business here in Branson and come to town numerous times a year. The last several yrs, this hotel has been my consistent choice. Nice people, helpful always and in Branson style, treat you like family. Wireless in rooms, quiet and convenient. A little tired in spots but hey they are renovating as I type this, and even in it's slightly tired state it's light years better than most other places in town.

Reviews.Title: “Not Typical”
Reviews.Author: Bondman1059
Reviews.Content: The amenities here are those that you would find in a Hampton Inn however, there hotel appears to be converted from a prior chain. I am used to the Hamptons being newer so I was suprised at the age of the property. The staff was very helpful in all regards, great location on the strip. Free breakfast and indoor pool makes it a great place for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, older Hampton”
Reviews.Author: Zach D
Reviews.Content: We stay at hamptons quite a big, staff was friendly, hotel right on strip, the rooms were a bit older than other hamptons but still updated in the last 10 years or less, beds were good but no in room fridge was a letdown.. Free wifi and breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “In a great location”
Reviews.Author: Crystal_SD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is need of being upgraded, but it does what its supposed to do. It offers a complimentary breakfast in the mornings and has great customer service. The bathroom had a sink outside of the bathroom for a second location for getting ready if wanted. But the shower lacked power and barely did its job and the toilet had a hard time flushing. The bed was amazing as most Hampton Inn beds are.

Reviews.Title: “November 10, 2011”
Reviews.Author: Janie L
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at this hotel. We spent 4 nights here. The location is great, the facilities are nice and everyone was nice, friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet had a lot of variety; there was something for everyone and there was plenty of room for everyone to enjoy their breakfast. The bathroom was a little dated, but we liked having 2 separate sinks and dressing areas. That was a big plus. It would be nice if a little more money was spent on the facial and toilet tissue. That was my biggest complaint. We would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Way To Stay”
Reviews.Author: BJSueB
Reviews.Content: When you go to Branson, the way to stay is at the Hampton Inn on the Strip. From the Check in to the check out, our stay was perfection. The front desk staff were friendly, helpful and courteous. They took pride in their work and it showed. Once in our room and were settled, the front desk even called to ask if everything was satisfactory. The hotel is situated in the middle of all the action - only a short walk to the Mickey Gilley Theatre and the Jim Staffford Theatre is just down the block. Restaurants are also close by. Loved our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly Floor”
Reviews.Author: voyager413
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the week october 3, 2011 on the 5th floor. The smell as we came off the elevator on the 5th floor was the strong odor of fresh mothballs. This odor carried over into the room we stayed in. After placing a plug in style scent remover product in the room, we were able to handle the smell. The hotel otherwise was clean, and had the standard hampton conditions. The breakfast was the usual hot items/cold items and fresh fruits. In past stays of hampton's, the bill was ready that morning and delivered under the door, but not here. You get it when you check out at the desk. It was easy to access the strip from here, with many places close by.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location for site seeing, less than average accommodations”
Reviews.Author: underwaterman
Reviews.Content: Although I was in Branson, MO for a tv shoot that had nothing to do with the Branson strip, this hotel was a good choice as far as ease of access to the strip. The hotel lobby was fine and breakfast was ok for a free breakfast. The rooms were outdated though and not fresh. The water is soft and it's hard to wash the soap off with the weak pressure mixed in. Wireless internet was free but not very powerful. They had a pool that I saw some families in but it was indoor and quite crowded - no room to relax but it's to be expected in such a family oriented location.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: typinggirl45
Reviews.Content: As usual Hampton Inn was clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. Will definitely be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “We come back every year”
Reviews.Author: AveryGirls
Reviews.Content: We stay here when picking our daughters up from camp every year. It is always very clean which makes this quick trip great. The staff always makes us feel very welcome and they make you feel like they know you. I am not sure if they look at past stays but it sure feels like they do. Love to go eat at Cantina Laredo while we are down there. Traffic can be horrible even late at night - try to stay off the strip if you can. The hotel is very close to the outlet mall down there.

Reviews.Title: “We definitely will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: Janalee
Reviews.Content: We had a suite with king bed & sofa bed.......the room was lovely with a fantastic view! We love staying at Hampton Inns with comfy beds & a wonderful breakfast... we were surprised when we read reviews of this property saying it was outdated & in need of redoing. The room was spacious, everything was in proper working order, the bed was as comfy as we are accustomed to at Hampton Inn & it was NOT in need of updating! The employees at the front desk were very friendly & helpful. It is a great location on the Strip....we spent 4 nights at this location & will definitely stay here again when we return to Branson .......highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DLN310
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn for the week while attending the Week of Increase Conference, at the Faith Life Church located directly behind the hotel. The staff were so welcoming, extremely helpful, and accommodated all our needs. We were blessed with a microwave and fridge at no extra cost. The spacious Lobby area offered coffee, tea, and cookies, and was the perfect setting for all our after-conference meetings with new friends. Our room was clean, quiet, and had all the comforts of home. The beds were comfortable, and the showers were hot. The view from our room's window in the back side of the hotel offered beautiful glimpses of autumn. The Hot Breakfast, included in the price of the reasonable room fee, was delicious and plentiful! There were elevators, a pool, fitness area, coin operated laundry room, and internet access in the lobby area. The Hampton Inn was in walking distance to many restaurants, entertainment, and shopping. We loved the hotel, it's wonderful staff, and all the amenities it included. We did not have a rental car, and were able to get everywhere we wanted to go by walking. There is also transportation available 24 hours a day by cab, minivan, or limo @ 417-332-CABS (2227) to pick up or drop off at the Airports, or to drive you around Branson. We hope to return this October to Branson, and would definitely stay at the Hampton Inn again!

Reviews.Title: “A must stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lillylove11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is spotless. They keep everything so clean you could lick it. The rooms were beautiful and spacious. The beds were incredible and we were well rested for the next days every day. The continental breakfast is delicious with lots of options and again very clean. The pool is clean, slightly foggy in the heat but otherwise quite nice. Location is excellent within walking distance of museums and shows. Give this hotel a chance! Its a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the money...”
Reviews.Author: disgusted41
Reviews.Content: Room was ok, but dated. Room needed painted. Doors needed replaced. The lady at the desk was extremely helpful. Very quiet room. Good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with Choice”
Reviews.Author: dikline
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this Hampton and found it to be not only in a great location, but also it was clean and the personnel were friendly and helpful. We did note that in some former hotels, there was a reservation desk for show tickets. This hotel does not have that convenience, but we had used Terry's Transports to deliver tickets prior for the more popular shows, so it worked out ok. Tickets were waiting for us at the desk when we arrived. I would definitely recommend this hotel for your Branson stay.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the Road Hampton”
Reviews.Author: InfrequentVacationer
Reviews.Content: I've decided it would be simplest to group the positive & negatives of our stay accordingly, and readers can focus on the things that matter the most to them when making a decision whether or not to stay at this hotel. We stayed in a room with two queen beds. Positives: - The woman who took our reservation on the phone was very helpful and friendly. - The room contained attractive, yet simple furniture. - There was a small chest of drawers or dresser that was just the right height for placing luggage on top of it, in addition to a folding luggage stand. - Iron & ironing board and hair dryer in room. - A nice assortment of pillows of various degrees of softness/firmness were on each bed. - There was a newer flat screen TV with a good picture. - There were two sinks in the room - one inside the bathroom and one outside. - Although we didn't use it, we could see the indoor pool and hot tub when we ate breakfast, and I noticed there were towels down there so that you don't have to bring one from your room. However, swimmers need to be aware that this pool area is visible from not only the lobby, but also to people walking outside on their way to the front door. - The breakfast was generous and good (except for a rather strange-tasting danish I tried). The seating area is very generous; it probably allows for more diners than any other hotel I've stayed in. There were two rooms full of tables, as well as a long "community table." - The breakfast workers were very friendly and helpful. - We opted out of maid service, and upon our return to our room there was a nice note slid under the door by the maids informing us that they came back at 4:00 and we still had the "Do Not Disturb" sign on our door. They advised us to check with the front desk for clean towels and supplies. - We requested a last-minute late check-out, and it was cheerfully granted to us. Negatives: - I found the bed to be hard. My shoulder and hip hurt in the morning. - The duvet on one bed was slightly dirty in one area. - There is a bright green light on the smoke alarm that kind of lights up the room when you're trying to sleep. (I think red lights make more sense for this purpose.) - The air conditioning unit in our room made an occasional humming sound during the night which woke me up a few times. - Our room didn't have a working exhaust fan in the bathroom. - The bathtub/shower had a slow drain that would make the bathtub fill up with water as we showered. - Also, the pipes in our room made an intermittent whistling/squealing sound when using either the shower or the sink outside of the bathroom. - The towels are advertised to be "fluffy," yet we found they had fluffy towels on top and thin, scratchy towels underneath them. - We found a large roach in our room, on the wall near the door to the room. - Although the hotel's website advertises a "Business Center," it actually consists of one computer on a very small desk right next to breakfast tables, offering no privacy from diners. Also it should be noted that there is a sign next the computer stating that access to social sites such as Facebook, adult sites, and gambling sites is not allowed. We were glad to see the policy regarding adult sites and gambling, but we thought some people may not be happy about the social sites restriction.

Reviews.Title: “Really shows it's age”
Reviews.Author: goinallover
Reviews.Content: We checked in here after we discovered that the other Hampton had very small rooms without fridge and microwave. This Hampton did have the suite with fridge, micro, couch, and plenty of room. HOWEVER.....the room and public areas were dingy and stained, the furniture in the room was broken (tv stand falling apart, baseboards broken, coffee table broken), the couch had holes in the arms, Litter on the hall floor remained there for 3 days. This Hampton seriously needs a makeover. The breakfast lady was fantastic and went out of her way to be friendly and helpful to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - saved our trip!!”
Reviews.Author: amyjam0807
Reviews.Content: We started off our trip in another hotel and after our first night, we left due to nasty carpet and ants all over the sink! It was Labor Day weekend and a lot of places were booked but we were so lucky the Hampton Inn still had a king room avaliable. It was 6 in the morning when I called them and they said we could come over and immeadiately check in at no extra cost. We packed up at the other place and were there within the hour! They were SO nice at the front desk and insisted on us eating breakfast, even though we were not guests the night before. Our room was more then perfect! Super clean, super comfortable, and perfect size for me, my husband and 2 year old daughter. We loved the view because we could see the helicopters taking off and landing, which kept my daughter pretty entertained! The breakfast was excellent. We ate there every morning durning our 3 day stay. The lobby was nice - my husband even enjoyed some "down time" reading there while me and my daughter took a nap. We never had a promblem with the Wi-Fi conection. Bathroom was nice, shower was nice, pool was nice and clean...I honestly can't say there is anything wrong with this hotel. We travel to Branson often, and I don't think we will ever stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - no complaints”
Reviews.Author: famof5iowa
Reviews.Content: We spent the first night of our Branson vacation here (already had a condo on Table Rock Lake booked for the rest of the trip). The room was clean and nice. Breakfast the following morning was very good however very crowded and busy. We did not have a chance to swim in the pool area however we did take and look at it and it appeared very well kept and clean. I would not have a problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - great location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: webjanet
Reviews.Content: The rooms are wonderful, the location is perfect and the staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast each morning is delicious and Included. Free Wifi and free use of computer in lobby are great to print show tickets and discounts. Many show discounts are available only online so make use of it! The pool and hot tub are really nice, too! Sleeping is great in very cozy beds! The lobby was also the perfect place for our family to eat pizza we had delivered from a local pizza place, and free coffee and fruit are available all day long!

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: divergirlt
Reviews.Content: First of all let me say that I research Trip Advisor before I go ANYWHERE. My hard earned vacation dollars are very important to me and I do not like surprises. With that said, I am glad I followed my gut feeling and not that of some of the reviews about this Hampton Inn. This hotel, simply said, was wonderful in every aspect. My wife and I went there for a week long anniversary trip and had a great time. Here is the breakdown: HOTEL: The hotel sits in a perfect location on Hwy 76, one block from the yellow and red routes. It is only 4 miles to Silver Dollar City. Parking is free and plentiful. It is close to numerous restaurants and music shows. The property, inside and out, is very clean. Indoor pool and hottub which was nice after a long day being a tourist. Room: We had a room on the 4th floor on the back side. It had a nice view of the mountains and a large church parking lot. It was very clean and spacious with a flat screen tv. It had a seperate sink/dressing area and nice size closet. Also the standard desk/chair combo and a comfy chair and ottoman. Bed was very comfortable as is the usual with Hampton Inn. Staff: Absolutely wonderful. Greeted with a warm "good morning" every day. Very eager to please and accomodate. Even told me how to save some money on the music shows. Note: use the ticket service they recommend. Tickets were cheaper than anywhere else and you can order them by phone and they will drop them off at front desk at no charge! Very convenient. Staff was some of the nicest folks I have ever met. Breakfast: Always two hot items and belgian waffles every morning. Great selection of cereals, pastries, fruits, yogurts, etc. A very good start to the day and it's included! The hotel has a nice, very comfortable resting/lounge area in the front lobby. Every afternoon, they have warm chocolate chip cookies and a USA Today paper to enjoy. The manager, Debbie Kitchen, is doing a great job with this property. The property is 18 years old but you cannot tell it by looking. It is very clean and does not look in any way rundown. I had absolutely no problems with security issues or the daily maid service. Overall, just a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: memphis34
Reviews.Content: We had some clothes stolen from our closet and nothing was done about it. Will never ever stay here!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice stay”
Reviews.Author: markw89311
Reviews.Content: Hotel has all the Hampton inn amenities. The common areas and elevators seemed a little less appealing than other Hamptons, but otherwise, our room was nice, the employees were helpful and friendly, and it was overall a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - no suprises”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1234Missouri
Reviews.Content: Nice place. Absolutely nothing wrong or undesirable from our perspective. 2 adults & child stayed for 2 days on 5th (top) floor, odd numbered room that was on the (east) side away from the strip. I imagine this is probably the "quiet side". If you want to see the fireworks at Celebration City at night from your window get a room on the side along the highway, which may(?) expose you to some traffic noise. Overall it was very quiet. While we heard a slamming door or two, we never heard any voices. Clean, modern room & bath with very comfortable beds. Lots of extra pillows to choose from. No A/C, plumbing or electrical issues. Indoor pool & hot tub. Clean, clear, no chlorine smell, and good temp. The pool was a bit smaller than I prefer - your not going to swim laps here - but was fine for splashing around in. 3' deep at one end quickly dropping off to 5' for most of it. The pool area didn't have much activity at all. We had it totally to ourselves the first night, and there was just one other family there the second. I'm guessing this is mostly due to this time of year most guests are Sr. citizens that may not use the pool as much. (but it did seem a little odd that essentially no one else was using it. Oh well, that not a complaint!) Front desk was quick and courteous. The ladies running the breakfast areas did an awesome job. They were working like crazy, keeping everything full and cleaned up. They put up temporary tables in the lobby area to handle the "crunch-time" breakfast crowd so there was always a table available. That was nice. I hate fighting over a table for breakfast. Different egg/sausage combos each morning. If you don't have time for breakfast, there are "breakfast grab bags" at the front desk w/ fruit, muffin, cereal bar & water you can grab and take with you. I've never seen this before - not sure how common it is - but I thought it was neat. Wireless internet was OK. While I (usually) got 11 MBS, the signal was clearly low strength side in our room. Could have been better, but it worked. This place was the classic Hampton Inn formula. I suspect you could find a slightly better rate at other hotels in town, but this was a solid place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “On the strip, close to it all”
Reviews.Author: travelintexan07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights while visiting Branson. It was myself, my mom and two kids. The hotel is older, but had a clean pool area, nice hottub, big eating area with a nice size hot breakfast every morning. Hot coffee throughout the day. Rooms were older, in need of remodeling, but decent size. Wifi was available in room, but was out for 2 of the 3 days we were there. It is at the end of the busy strip, but close enough to do some walking to attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Cold Showers in the winter...Brrrr”
Reviews.Author: TravelPara
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel primarily because my husband and I love comfortable beds and relaxing in the hot tub and our kids love swimming in pools. This hotel was in a great location for those seeking a hotel with a comfortable bed near Silver Dollar City. But if one is expecting a warm shower in the morning, they may want to go elsewhere. Both days/nights we were there, we had to take COLD showers, the hot tub was broken, and the heated pool was no longer heated. Breakfast was okay and the service was okay. If it weren't for the cold showers I would stay here again. But I have grown accustom to my warm showers...

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn Branson - Nice & Clean”
Reviews.Author: SalemsFortress
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn in Branson was clean and had an Indoor Pool. 5 floors. Nice, Clean, Quiet in a good location. Indoor corridors, which I like. Had a Sink inside the bathroom and also a vanity/Sink outside so that was nice. Decent free Breakfast with a few hot items. Large Breakfast area with room for lots of guests. The breakfast area overlooked the pool which was a few floors below. I did not feel comfortable going to the pool feeling that the windows above overlooked into the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: 807wheaton
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Branson so we weren't sure if this was a good location for us to stay. This Hampton Inn is about at the end of the strip of restaurants, shows, etc. There is a Cracker Barrel just a five minute walk down the street and an Olive Garden across from the Cracker Barrel. Our visit was in late October so the traffic was not too bad, and that probably helped make this a good place for us. The room and bathroom were very clean. There is a sink outside the bath/toilet area, which I always appreciate. There were plenty of electrical outlets in this room. I had no trouble finding an outlet for my laptop near the round table, which was a good workplace. All the lights had 100 watt bulbs. Very good - now that we are retired we travel in the fall and it gets dark early, so having good lighting is important to us as we spend our evening time reading, doing crosswords, etc. Another couple we know stayed in the room across the hall from us. Their room had a flatscreen TV but our room did not. The large eating area was very nice, as it overlooked the indoor swimming pool. They offered hot chocolate all day and kept the apple basket full during the afternoon and evening. The lobby lounge is ajacent to the eating/breakfast area so it's very handy and pleasant. We spent two nights there so they offered different sausage and egg entrees each morning. One morning they served fajitas with scrambled eggs and sausage mixed together with salsa for an optional topper. The next morning they had sausage patties and fried eggs with white gravy. They had plenty of food out during the serving time. Most of the people staying there were retired like us and enjoying a relaxing morning. The lobby was quite large and had plenty of room to lounge and congregate for games, conversation, and for using the Internet service they provided. The check in staff was very friendly and helpful. We arrived on a Thursday evening and they had hot chocolate chip cookies sitting out but they did not offer them on Friday and Saturday, the weekend evenings. Our room was cleaned while we were gone and ready for us by the time we returned in the early afternoon. I would recommend this Hampton Inn during a visit to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite in Branson”
Reviews.Author: BigTXN
Reviews.Content: This was our third time to stay here. Bathroom has a good sized lavatory and there is a second lav located outside the bathroom door. They have an exercise room and wi-fi. Lobby is on floor 2, ice machines on floors 2 & 4. We like the west end location. Breakfast was standard Hampton issue except the sausage patties were extra good one morning.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, comfortable beds and great location”
Reviews.Author: ElleeNebraska
Reviews.Content: There were four of us ladies in one roon with two queen beds (which made the rate excellent) and it was roomy enough for all of us. It more than met our two highest requirements, cleanliness and comfortable beds, and really can't think of a single complaint any of us had. The fact we had to share one bathroom was of our choosing so we made it work and they do have an extra vanity outside the bathroom so that helped. Location, breakfast and staff all great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Below Average Premises”
Reviews.Author: terrymary
Reviews.Content: The room was recently redecorated with very nice down pillows and white down bedding, lapdesks,etc. The bathroom, towels, etc. were very nice. A nice touch were the breakfast-to-go sacks with water bottles, apple, muffin at the lobby desk for those who didn't have time to enjoy the complimentary breakfast. The premises (lobby, hallways, pool, etc.) were run down and disappointing. It's conveniently located near the beginning of the strip so it was easy to get to Silver Dollar City and avoid the traffic. We ended up checking out a day early and went to the Grand Country Inn so the kids could enjoy the waterpark (it was 104 degrees) since there wasn't much going on at the Hampton for kids. But if you just need a good room to sleep in, then this is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Beds!”
Reviews.Author: yourneighbor
Reviews.Content: 2 adults, 2 kids - 13 and 9, on long weekend trip to Branson, MO Comfortable beds, new mattresses, soft squishy duvet covers, fluffy pillows. Two QUEEN beds, which is important to us. Room seemed on the largish side, and was nicely decorated, obviously updated recently. Bathroom was roomy, curved shower curtain so you're not fighting with the curtain, ya know? Waterpik shower head. Pool was clean, open 'till 10 pm, lots of towels, HOT TUB/jacuzzi was working! yay! Not always the case when you go to a hotel... Breakfast was really great - different hot items each day; french toast sticks, biscuits/gravy, eggs...always cereal, fruits, juices, things to put in a toaster, and sweets like muffins and pastries. Different coffees too. Seemed to be plenty of seating - I think it's open from 6 am-10 am, so people trickled in and out. Staff very nice, helpful. Across the street is a big trinket shop - souveneirs, etc. Oh - they also have a computer sitting in the lobby so you can check emails, look up show times, too. Very nice. Laundry on 1st floor with pool, so if you're soaked from Silver Dollar City you can dry your things there - $1.00 to dry. We stay in lots of hotels, so I know now to ask for room away from elevator/stairs and ice machines. Quiet room on 5th floor was great!! We were facing the strip - 76, and at night, the kids watched the fireworks from Celebration City outside the window. I'm also going to write reviews for SDCity, Branson, and Dolly Parton's Dixie Stampede show. We had a great time!!

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn Branson West excellent”
Reviews.Author: BCMinn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton for 3 nights and we were very pleased. One of the best of the amenities is the bed. I have a spine problem and comfort is very important and I found that these beds are some of the best I have slept in. The room was also very clean. We also found that the pool was warm and nice to be able to excercise in and the whirlpool was soothing. Again at the end of the day, I was ready for something like this to loosen my spine. We found the staff very friendly and they constantly seemed to want to make our stay enjoyable Also around 4:00 p.m. if you are around, it is hard to resist the fresh hot chocolate chip cookies they set out. Another nice thing we liked about it was that it is located in a less busy area where it is quieter. I always take these reviews objectively and realize sometimes you just get a bad night at times. Also some people will pick a place apart even if there is nothing to really pick apart. But I would definitely highly recommend this place to anyone. B.C. , Minneapolis, Mn

Reviews.Title: “This Hampton Inn Has Lost Our Business”
Reviews.Author: gumba56ks
Reviews.Content: First of all my wife and I have been going to Branson 2 to 3 times per year driving from the Kansas City area. We love Branson and had spent a majority of our stays at The Hampton Inn West. Well our last stay in April 2007 will probably be our last as there are many other hotels to choose from. Why the change? 1) I am a Hilton Diamond member ( the top of the line for frequent travelers-Hampton is owned by Hilton Corp) I worked hard in my travels to obtain my status. When asked about a room upgrade I was basically told that being a Diamond member at this hotel doesn't mean much--If it was January or February than maybe they could have done something for me. 2) We were there the 3rd weekend in April, stayed a long weekend. I had my lap top and tried many times to connect to their wireless web and had problems. When I asked the front desk manager for help she was kind of short and said that she didn't know anything about it and to call the number in my room for help. I called 3 times. The first time I called they couldn't help me and told me they'd call me back, which they never did. Bottom line we were able to periodically connect. The help line told me that I probably couldn't connect because most of the guests were probably trying to use the web. That's reassuring on a weekend. 3) My wife and I felt the oevrall customer service has declined at this facility. They used to be more friendly but now they have a basic service attitude. They have changed the general manager and eliminated small things, that make a difference, like free evening ice cream. 4) The claimed they did a renovation last winter. The only major renovation in our room was the new beds. Everything else, including the older carpet were the same. ( The beds they replaced should have been replace at least 5 years ago but the owners of this facility were holding out as long as possible without having to reinvest in their guests comfort) If it wasn't for the brand new Hilton Hotel opening at The New Branson Landing the beds would probably still be the same old ones--I would recommend checking out the new Hilton as it looks really nice Bottom line is The Hampton is average. They, like many hotels in Branson, derive their business on group tours(senior citizens) who are there on a bus tour and stay 2 to 3 days and are happy with what they get. This Hampton used to be a step up in their service but now I feel like they treat you as a group tour-take it or leave it. Well my wife and I are taking our $85 per night elsewhere where we can spend less and get better service. Sincerely, A Disappointed Hilton Diamond Member

Reviews.Title: “Great location for enjoying Branson!”
Reviews.Author: pjmcjm
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights August 1st-3rd at this Hampton Inn with my 10-year-old son and 11-year-old niece. We were in their "mini-suite" (Room 530). It is an oversized room with a king-size bed, a sleeper sofa, tv with cable, mini-kitchen that had a small fridge, microwave and coffeemaker. The bathroom was average size, and there was an additional vanity across from the closet. The decor was nice...typically neutral with a pretty bedspread and a couple of attractive pictures on the walls. There are plenty of towels, and the hotel and our room were very clean. The hallways are wide and well-lit. One oddity...the coffeemaker has no glass pot. You can only brew one cup of coffee at a time. Paper cups are provided, but it is really strange and probably only works well with one adult in the room! The free breakfast is located in a nice separate area right off of the lobby...great selection of donuts, bagels, toast, cereal etc. And in the evening (9:30 to 11 PM), they serve vanilla softserve with three choices of toppings for free! (The kids love that!). There is a nice pool and hot tub located in a very large room on the lower level; the hotel provides towels in the swimming area so you don't have to take them from your room. The front desk people are quite friendly and helpful. Extra pillows and blankets were available upon request. There is a charming lady in the lobby that will get you tickets for any of the shows. On the main floor, there are ice and vending machines. The hotel is very quiet, and there are plenty of USA Today's every morning in the lobby. If you are a Hilton Honors member, they will hang one on your door. This hotel is perfectly located to enjoy the three main theme parks of Branson...White Water, Silver Dollar City and Celebration City. We could get back to the Hampton Inn from Celebration City in less than 5 minutes. All in all, a great place to stay in the Branson area!! I have stayed there several times and plan to do so again at Christmas!

HotelInfo.Name: Hampton Inn Branson on the Strip
HotelInfo.Address: 3695 Country Music Blvd., Branson, MO 65616
